001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders;
002
003import java.util.Optional;
004
005import io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonDemographic;
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.ImmutableInHostMarkovState;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.ImmutableInHostMarkovStateMachine;
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.InHostMarkovState;
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.InHostMarkovState.DiseaseState;
010import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.InHostMarkovState.SymptomState;
011import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
012import io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.MarkovStateModel;
013import io.github.ai4ci.util.Conversions;
014import io.github.ai4ci.util.ReflectionUtils;
015import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
016
017/**
018 * Default initialiser for the Markov in‑host model.
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * This interface supplies a focussed default implementation that converts a
022 * {@link MarkovStateModel} configuration and execution parameters into an
023 * {@link InHostMarkovState} instance. The implementation samples durations and
024 * produces per‑day transition probabilities used by the Markov in‑host state
025 * machine.
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * Role in composition: the method defined here is intended to be used by
029 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultPersonInitialiser} and is
030 * composed into {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder}. In
031 * the default composition the model builder delegates to this interface's
032 * default method via
033 * {@code DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser.super.initialiseInHostModel(...)}.
034 * This separation keeps in‑host specific logic isolated and easily replaceable.
035 *
036 * <p>
037 * Demographic adjustment: the implementation consults the optional
038 * {@link PersonDemographic} and applies demographic adjustments using
039 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.util.ReflectionUtils#modify} before sampling from the
040 * configuration. This allows age or group specific variation in incubation and
041 * symptom timings via the configured
042 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.DemographicAdjustment.Markov}.
043 *
044 * <p>
045 * Extension guidance: implementers that need different Markov initial behaviour
046 * should replace this interface or subclass the model builder and override the
047 * delegation point. Keep the initialiser responsible only for creating the
048 * initial immutable in‑host state; avoid performing heavy IO here unless
049 * managed by the calling builder.
050 *
051 * @author Rob Challen
052 */
053public interface DefaultInHostMarkovStateInitialiser {
054
055        /**
056         * Create an {@link InHostMarkovState} from a Markov configuration.
057         *
058         * <p>
059         * The default implementation applies demographic adjustments (if a
060         * {@code PersonDemographic} is present), samples distributional durations
061         * and computes mean rates and per‑day probabilities using the
062         * {@link Conversions} helpers. The returned state initialises the internal
063         * state machine transition probabilities.
064         *
065         * @param configuration the Markov in‑host configuration (possibly adjusted)
066         * @param execConfig    the execution configuration providing population
067         *                      rates
068         * @param person        optional person demographic used for demographic
069         *                      adjustment
070         * @param rng           sampler used for stochastic sampling
071         * @param time          current simulation time used for time stamped state
072         * @return an initial {@link InHostMarkovState}
073         */
074        default InHostMarkovState initialiseInHostModel(
075                        MarkovStateModel configuration, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig,
076                        Optional<PersonDemographic> person, Sampler rng, int time
077        ) {
078
079                if (person.isPresent()) {
080                        configuration = ReflectionUtils.modify(
081                                        configuration, execConfig.getDemographicAdjustment(),
082                                        person.get()
083                        );
084                }
085
086                double infectiousDuration = configuration.getInfectiousDuration()
087                                .sample(rng);
088
089                // developing symptoms can only happen whilst infectious.
090                // however infection duration i s a 95% quantile
091                // and on average people are only infectious for less time than this.
092                double meanInfectiousDuration = 1
093                                / Conversions.rateFromQuantile(infectiousDuration, 0.95);
094
095                double symptomDuration = configuration.getSymptomDuration().sample(rng);
096
097                // likewise the mean symptomDuration is shorter than this:
098
099                double meanSymptomDuration = 1
100                                / Conversions.rateFromQuantile(symptomDuration, 0.95);
101
102                // A per day probability that symptoms have finished assuming duration is
103                // based on a 95% probability of resolution.
104                double dailyProbabilityResolutionSymptoms = Conversions
105                                .probabilityFromQuantile(symptomDuration, 0.95);
106                double dailyProbabilityUnresolvedSymptoms = 1
107                                - dailyProbabilityResolutionSymptoms;
108
109                double dailyProbabilityFatalityGivenCase = Conversions
110                                .probabilityFromQuantile(
111                                                meanSymptomDuration, execConfig.getCaseFatalityRate()
112                                );
113
114                double dailyProbabilityHospitalisationGivenCase = Conversions
115                                .probabilityFromQuantile(
116                                                meanSymptomDuration, execConfig.getCaseHospitalisationRate()
117                                );
118
119                return ImmutableInHostMarkovState.builder().setTime(time)
120                                // .setConfig(configuration)
121                                .setInfectionCaseRate(execConfig.getInfectionCaseRate())
122                                .setInfectionHospitalisationRate(
123                                                execConfig.getInfectionHospitalisationRate()
124                                ).setInfectionFatalityRate(execConfig.getInfectionFatalityRate())
125                                .setDiseaseState(DiseaseState.SUSCEPTIBLE)
126                                .setSymptomState(SymptomState.ASYMPTOMATIC)
127                                .setMachine(
128                                                ImmutableInHostMarkovStateMachine.builder()
129                                                                .setPExposedInfectious(
130                                                                                Conversions.probabilityFromPeriod(
131                                                                                                configuration.getIncubationPeriod()
132                                                                                                                .sample(rng)
133                                                                                )
134                                                                )
135                                                                .setPInfectiousImmune(
136                                                                                Conversions.probabilityFromQuantile(
137                                                                                                infectiousDuration, 0.95
138                                                                                )
139                                                                )
140                                                                .setPImmuneSusceptible(
141                                                                                Conversions.probabilityFromHalfLife(
142                                                                                                configuration.getImmuneWaningHalfLife()
143                                                                                                                .sample(rng)
144                                                                                )
145                                                                )
146
147                                                                .setPAsymptomaticSymptomatic(
148                                                                                // The total proportion of symptomatic cases is
149                                                                                // the result of the per day probability
150                                                                                // aggregated over the infectious duration.
151                                                                                Conversions.probabilityFromQuantile(
152                                                                                                meanInfectiousDuration,
153                                                                                                execConfig.getInfectionCaseRate()
154                                                                                )
155                                                                )
156                                                                .setPSymptomaticAsymptomatic(
157                                                                                dailyProbabilityResolutionSymptoms
158                                                                )
159                                                                .setPSymptomaticDead(
160                                                                                dailyProbabilityUnresolvedSymptoms
161                                                                                                * dailyProbabilityFatalityGivenCase
162                                                                )
163                                                                .setPSymptomaticHospitalised(
164                                                                                (dailyProbabilityUnresolvedSymptoms
165                                                                                                + dailyProbabilityUnresolvedSymptoms
166                                                                                                                * dailyProbabilityFatalityGivenCase)
167                                                                                                * dailyProbabilityHospitalisationGivenCase
168                                                                )
169
170                                                                .setPHospitalisedAsymptomatic(
171                                                                                dailyProbabilityResolutionSymptoms
172                                                                )
173                                                                // TODO: review logic for fatality rate in Markov state
174                                                                // in host model
175                                                                .setPHospitalisedDead(
176                                                                                dailyProbabilityUnresolvedSymptoms
177                                                                                                * dailyProbabilityFatalityGivenCase
178                                                                )
179
180                                                                .build()
181                                ).build();
182
183        }
184
185}
